availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Turner A. Lowey (Caldwell County, Kentucky, carpenter & justice of the peace)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, carpenter and justice of the peace. Tennessee native. Married to Winey Caroline Bennett Lowey in Crittenden County, Kentucky, on August 28, 1847. Father of James Lowey and Bettie Lowey. Married to Martha Lowey. Father of Jacob Lowey and I. T. Lowey. Carpenter in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Sarah Hollowell as a seamstress in Caldwell County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Caldwell County in 1861. Justice of the peace in Caldwell County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 43.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, Ford's Ferry, Precinct 5, p. 411B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film #000558428, p. 33.
KYR-0001-020-0019.
KYR-0001-020-0075.
